含义: 火 (huǒ) means 'fire' in Chinese. It symbolizes heat, energy, destruction, and transformation. In traditional Chinese philosophy, fire is one of the five elements (五行) and represents passion, dynamism, and the south direction.
字形: The character '火' is a pictograph that resembles flames. It consists of four strokes: a horizontal stroke at the top, two diagonal strokes crossing in the middle, and a vertical stroke at the bottom, representing the shape of a flame.
读音: The pronunciation of '火' is 'huǒ' in Mandarin, with the third tone.
字源: The character '火' originated from ancient pictographs depicting flames. Over time, its form evolved into the simplified version used today. It is one of the oldest Chinese characters, dating back to oracle bone inscriptions.
成语: 火上浇油 (huǒ shàng jiāo yóu) - to add fuel to the fire
火冒三丈 (huǒ mào sān zhàng) - to fly into a rage
如火如荼 (rú huǒ rú tú) - like a raging fire
星火燎原 (xīng huǒ liáo yuán) - a single spark can start a prairie fire
例句: 火可以取暖，也可以带来灾难。 (Fire can provide warmth but also bring disaster.)
星星之火，可以燎原。 (A single spark can start a prairie fire.)
短故事: In ancient China, a small village was saved from a wildfire by a clever farmer who dug a trench to stop the flames. This story symbolizes the power of ingenuity and preparation.
The legend of the Fire God (火神) tells of a deity who controlled fire and taught humans how to use it for cooking and warmth, marking the beginning of civilization.
诗词:
《静夜思》 - 李白
床前明月光，疑是地上霜。
举头望明月，低头思故乡。
(While not directly about fire, this poem evokes the warmth of home and longing.)

《赋得古原草送别》 - 白居易
离离原上草，一岁一枯荣。
野火烧不尽，春风吹又生。
(The poem describes how grass regrows after being burned by wildfire, symbolizing resilience.)
